parts.title: Connecting HTML and JavaScript
parts.description:
To insert JavaScript code in an HTML page we use the <script> tag.
The two options are to write the JavaScript code inside the tag or link to a JavaScript file with a url.

parts.description: JavaScript variables are used to save some value or data to reuse it later. Declaring and using a variable is easy since you don't need to specify the type.

parts.title: Changing the DOM (the HTML or the page)
parts.description: To make websites interactive you might want to change the page by adding different styles or showing different data. To do that we fetch the element (html tag) that we want to change and make our changes on it.

parts.title: Events in the browser
parts.description: Every tag on the page has many events that you can listen to and assign a function to be called when that event happens. Some of the basic ones are click (a left click of the mouse on the tag), hover, keydown (when a user clicks a key on the keyboard) and many more events.

parts.title: Fetching data and Promises
parts.description: Fetching data is very common on the web, whether it is data that you show on the page like text or numbers or something else you need to show something to users. Often in JavaScript when fetching data, promises are in use.
parts.bottomText: You can simply open this URL https://jsonplaceholder.typicode.com/users in the browser and see the data that is being returned.
